tool_description: Constructs a chronological chain of ownership based on available provenance data, identifying owners, transfer dates, and methods of acquisition.

artwork_id.description: Unique identifier for the artwork being researched

known_owners.description: List of known owners or collectors

ownership_dates.description: Corresponding dates for each known owner

transfer_methods.description: Methods of transfer between owners (sale, inheritance, gift, etc.)

documentation_quality.description: Quality rating for each ownership record (high, medium, low)

error_messages: Mismatched array lengths: known_owners and ownership_dates arrays must have the same length.
Invalid date format: All dates must be in ISO 8601 format or recognizable date strings.
Chronological inconsistency: Ownership dates must be in logical chronological order.
Invalid transfer method: Transfer methods must be one of [sale, inheritance, gift, loan, theft, restitution, unknown].
Invalid documentation quality: Quality ratings must be one of [high, medium, low].
usage: Provide lists of known owners and corresponding dates to build a chronological ownership chain. The tool will organize the information chronologically and identify potential gaps or inconsistencies.

chain_completeness.description: Percentage completeness of the ownership chain (0-100)

identified_gaps.description: Date ranges where ownership is unclear

transfer_summary.description: Summary of how artwork transferred between owners

chain_confidence.description: Overall confidence in the ownership chain (0-100)
